intro: Tradescantia decipiens, commonly known as the wandering trifid, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that features striking, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive trifid (three-lobed) appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Tradescantia decipiens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden environments.
